briefTitle: Arm Motor Rehabilitation, Entertainment and Cognition System for the Elderly
officialTitle: Arm Motor Rehabilitation, Entertainment and Cognition System for the Elderly (Feasibility Study)

primary.description: BrightBrainer game difficulty setting is determined based on patient's past performance, in order to adapt the therapy to a given individual. It representing an average or difficulties of all games played in a session. The measure implies game play intensity and level of challenge
primary.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 3 weeks

primary.description: BrightBrainer game baseline and performance scores. Min. score is 0. Max depends on specific game.
primary.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 3 weeks

primary.description: Subjective evaluation feedback and overall ratings on BrightBrainer games. Consists of multiple questions, each ranked on a 5-point Likert scale, with 1 (min) and 5 (max).
primary.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 3 weeks

primary.measure: Therapist subjective evaluation using 5-point Likert scale
primary.description: Subjective evaluation given by the attending Occupational Therapist at the end of the experimental intervention. Multiple questions, each ranked from 1 (min) to 5 (max)

secondary.description: measurement of active movement initiated by participant using a mechanical goniometer
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline arm range of motion at 3 weeks

secondary.description: finger extension/flexion range using a mechanical goniomter
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline finger range of motion at 3 weeks
Change from Baseline grasp strength at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Pinch strength measured with fingers placed on a pinch meter
Measurement of shoulder strength using calibrated wrist weights
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline shoulder strength at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Upper Extremity Motor function, score scale is 0 (min) to 66 (max). Larger score means better outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline Fugl-Meyer Assessment Score at 3 weeks

secondary.description: A self report of independence in 20 activities of daily living (ADLs). Total score range is 0 (min) to 80 (max). Larger score means better outcome.
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline Upper Extremity Functional Inex score at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Chedoke Arm and Hand Activity Inventory, reflecting ADL independence in simulated bimanual activities. Min score 9, max score 63, with larger score meaning better outcomes.
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline CAHAI 9 score at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Timed test of 7 simulated activities of daily living. Lowest score is 0, largest score is 1260. Units are seconds. Lower score means better outcomes (faster completion).
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline Jebsen Test of Hand Function score at 3 weeks

secondary.measure: Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI II) score
secondary.description: participants' depression measure. Range is 0 (min) to 63 (max). Lower score indicate better outcomes (less depression).
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline depression severity at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Attention module digit span (working memory) in the Neuropsychological Assessment Battery NAB min 0, larger score is better
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline verbal attention at 3 weeks

secondary.description: verbal fluency test min 0, larger score is better
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline verbal fluency at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Hopkins Verbal Learning Test, Revised (HVLT-R) min 0, larger is better
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline verbal learning memory at 3 weeks

secondary.description: A measure of memory function min 50 std of 10, larger score is better
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline visuospatial memory at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Word Generation min 0, larger is better
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline executive function at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Trail Making Test B (TMT-B) lMin 50, std of 10, larger number means better outcomes
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline Trail Making Test B (TMT-B) Score at 3 weeks

secondary.description: NAB Executive Functioning Module min 50, std is 10, larger number means better outcomes
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline NAB Exec Score at 3 weeks

secondary.description: Attention module dots (visual) in the Neuropsychological Assessment Battery NAB
secondary.timeFrame: Change from Baseline visual attention at 3 weeks
